verses.kjv: Remember now thy Creator in the days of thy youth, while the evil days come not, nor the years draw nigh, when thou shalt say, I have no pleasure in them;
verses.ct: Keep your Creator in mind while you are still young, before the difficult days arrive and the years come when you'll say, 'I find no enjoyment in these.'

verses.kjv: While the sun, or the light, or the moon, or the stars, be not darkened, nor the clouds return after the rain:
verses.ct: Do this before the sun, the light, the moon, and the stars grow dim to you, and before the clouds keep rolling back after every rain.

verses.kjv: In the day when the keepers of the house shall tremble, and the strong men shall bow themselves, and the grinders cease because they are few, and those that look out of the windows be darkened,
verses.ct: A time will come when your arms — the guardians of your body — will shake, and your strong legs will become bent, and your teeth will stop working because so few remain, and your eyes will grow dim.

verses.kjv: And the doors shall be shut in the streets, when the sound of the grinding is low, and he shall rise up at the voice of the bird, and all the daughters of musick shall be brought low;
verses.ct: Your ears will become deaf to the noise of the street, the sound of chewing will fade, yet you'll wake at the slightest chirp of a bird, and all the tones of music will grow faint to you.

verses.kjv: Also when they shall be afraid of that which is high, and fears shall be in the way, and the almond tree shall flourish, and the grasshopper shall be a burden, and desire shall fail: because man goeth to his long home, and the mourners go about the streets:
verses.ct: You'll become afraid of heights, and dangers will lurk along every path. Your hair will turn white like almond blossoms, you'll drag yourself along like a worn-out grasshopper, and desire will fade away — because a person heads to their eternal resting place while mourners walk through the streets.

verses.kjv: Or ever the silver cord be loosed, or the golden bowl be broken, or the pitcher be broken at the fountain, or the wheel broken at the cistern.
verses.ct: Remember your Creator before the silver cord snaps, before the golden bowl shatters, before the jar breaks at the spring, or the wheel at the well falls apart.

verses.kjv: Then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit shall return unto God who gave it.
verses.ct: Then the dust will go back to the earth where it came from, and the spirit will go back to God who gave it.

verses.kjv: Vanity of vanities, saith the preacher; all is vanity.
verses.ct: "Absolutely meaningless!" says the Teacher. "Everything is meaningless."

verses.kjv: And moreover, because the preacher was wise, he still taught the people knowledge; yea, he gave good heed, and sought out, and set in order many proverbs.
verses.ct: Beyond being wise himself, the Teacher also passed on knowledge to the people. He carefully reflected, researched, and arranged many proverbs.

verses.kjv: The preacher sought to find out acceptable words: and that which was written was upright, even words of truth.
verses.ct: The Teacher worked to find just the right words, and what he wrote was honest — genuine words of truth.

verses.kjv: The words of the wise are as goads, and as nails fastened by the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.
verses.ct: The words of the wise are like cattle prods, and their collected sayings are like firmly driven nails — all of them given by one Shepherd.

verses.kjv: And further, by these, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.
verses.ct: One more thing, my son — take this warning: there is no end to the writing of books, and too much studying will exhaust your body.

verses.kjv: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
verses.ct: Here is the final conclusion to everything: Be wholeheartedly dedicated to God and obey his commandments, because this is the complete responsibility of every person.

verses.kjv: For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.
verses.ct: For God will bring every action to judgment, including every hidden thing, whether it is good or evil.
